paragraphs.text: Travelled to (and often got the chance to live in!) over 20 places around the world, including Hong Kong, Israel, South Africa, Australia, Tokyo, San Francisco, Berlin, San Diego, NYC, Nepal, Bangkok, Hawaii, London, Dublin and so many others.
paragraphs.name: bf38

bc875f3c9c6b.title: For me as a founder you guys are an inspiration.

paragraphs.text: For me as a founder you guys are an inspiration. We live in a time where companies know everything about people. Therefor companies should be transparent as well!!

paragraphs.text: Thank you for everything you’ve done for Buffer. I especially enjoyed the transparency value you have at Buffer — one of the initial reasons I wanted to be a happiness hero. The larger transparency movement you inspired in the tech community is simply astonishing. Who knew a…

paragraphs.text: We’ve never met in person but I know we at Hanno have felt really driven to keep up with what you guys have done on the transparency side of things and it has definitely made a huge positive difference to our team culture. I’ve always…

paragraphs.text: Thanks for everything Leo! Buffer, Joel and Yourself have been startup role models to me for a long time. Many decisions I make can in some part be tied back to a Buffer article or knowledge you and/or Joel shared.
paragraphs.name: bb19

paragraphs.text: Thanks for helping make the world transparent.

paragraphs.text: Congrats on the new company!
paragraphs.name: c73e

paragraphs.text: Would you mind sharing your thoughts on how you reconcile performance and diversity when it comes to hiring?
paragraphs.name: 7d9d

paragraphs.text: I believe you should hire the most performant candidate, regardless of sociodemographic factors. Diversity seems like the opposite of that. How do you reconcile these two philosophies?
paragraphs.name: f1b4

virtuals.subtitle: Would you mind sharing your thoughts on how you reconcile performance and diversity when it comes to hiring?

content.subtitle: Would you mind sharing your thoughts on how you reconcile performance and diversity when it comes to hiring?

cc35649366e6.title: As always, the depth of transparency from the BAB (Buffer and Beyond — may need rebranding) group…

paragraphs.text: As always, the depth of transparency from the BAB (Buffer and Beyond — may need rebranding) group is impressive. Thanks for being vulnerable and open. No doubt we’ll continue to see great things from you as well as the Buffer team in the future.

9d41875498ed.title: We met a year and a half ago in Berlin, if you recall, and in the little time we spent you were…

paragraphs.text: We met a year and a half ago in Berlin, if you recall, and in the little time we spent you were candid, humble and a great listener. I was going through a lot of bad things at the time, and the little talks we had during DNX's event and party were of great comfort. You're a great person, and everyone who knows you will probably agree that we all want…
paragraphs.name: 71d7

virtuals.subtitle: But I would be lying if I didn't say it's sad to see you go from such a great company. Buffer wouldn’t be what it is today if it wasn’t for…

46682172ecbb.title: A hearty congratulations for 6 amazing years of inspiring, leading, and unifying so many people …

paragraphs.text: A hearty congratulations for 6 amazing years of inspiring, leading, and unifying so many people — both inside and outside Buffer!
paragraphs.name: 294f

paragraphs.text: So many of us have been blessed and challenged to see and learn from you and Joel as you’ve pioneered a lot of incredible changes in the business world — and made an amazing product while doing it!
paragraphs.name: e26e

paragraphs.text: Stay happy, my friend!
paragraphs.name: c979

e654e9d63a17.title: Hi Leo. I’ve been a Buffer customer for years and feel connected to the company, mainly thanks to…

paragraphs.text: Hi Leo. I’ve been a Buffer customer for years and feel connected to the company, mainly thanks to your transparency. You’ve built something remarkable and I’m looking forward to seeing what comes next with Matter, which is super interesting.

f724f608163a.title: Thanks for all of your work, Leo.

paragraphs.text: Thanks for all of your work, Leo. I’m VERY excited about the work at Matter. You’re doing important work there.
paragraphs.name: c403

paragraphs.text: Really inspiring Leo Widrich!! Loved that transparency movement in tech. you’ve started! Been a fan since then! Good luck with your new project!
paragraphs.name: c61a

paragraphs.text: Good for you, Leo. It must have been a tough ride. Buffer is certainly competing in a very crowded space:
paragraphs.name: b974

virtuals.subtitle: And I question the relevance or necessity of social media schedulers when organic reach is now negligible.

content.subtitle: And I question the relevance or necessity of social media schedulers when organic reach is now negligible.

c01d0d678fb.title: Amazin story! And Matter looks fantastic and mostly needed. I’m sure you’ll make it a success!

paragraphs.text: Great post — honest and gracious. I’ve been a big fan of all you did at Buffer — good luck in your next venture :) I’m thrilled with the direction of your new company — I became a founding member of Tech Ladies because I think diversity and inclusion in tech is so important. Looking forward to following your journey with Matter.
paragraphs.name: 2d8b
